content.DESCRIPTION: An eco-conscious recipe app that encourages users to eat less meat, reducing their carbon footprint.
HOW_I_BUILT_IT: I developed the front-end of this project using React to create the different views, making it a single-page web app. I used React Router to switch between views.

I designed and built this over a span of 36 hours with one of my other team members. We worked with the rest of our team to set up a full stack app that could send and receive data to and from the back-end, including users' saved recipes, history, and requests to the Spotify API.

content.DESCRIPTION: A beginner friendly project manager to encourage young developers starting out to take on side projects.
HOW_I_BUILT_IT: I built this solo at a hackathon after first learning about web programming in Python and JavaScript. I used Django because it was the only framework I knew at the time.

It set up the SQLite database for me, and I accessed and updated it through the back-end to create users for the app and store their account data, namely projects and tasks. I designed the app and styled it with Sass and plain HTML.

content.DESCRIPTION: A chrome extension that keeps you informed of your privacy by parsing webpages you visit for their terms and privacy policy and provides a simplified summary of them.
HOW_I_BUILT_IT: I implemented the front-end and created a React app which we built as a Chrome extension for a better user experience. It was my first time building a Chrome extension which could interact with the current tab, which is how we parsed its content.
I also setup the Mongo database in the back-end and added integration for users to allow sites to be whitelisted and blacklisted specific to each user.
